intro: Leucadendron heterophillum, commonly known as the silver crown leucadendron, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-white bracts that surround its yellow flowers. The plant is evergreen, with narrow, needle-like leaves that give it a feathery appearance. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes for its unique foliage and seasonal blooms.
